result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Hopper Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substane Abuse Program.
34 days credit granted, if revoked.
Concurrent with: 14CF1372

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Forfeit the weapon.
Not to possess any weapons.

timeConds.notes: To be performed within 3 years as a Condition of Probation.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua A Hopper Hernandez
Current: PO Box 661, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2017)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joshua A Hopper Hernandez in court, in custody, with attorney Derek A Hawkins.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in. 

REFUND BAIL TO PERSON WHO POSTED IT. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 1/2 years - 34 days credit, Extended Supervision: 2 years) - concurrent to 14CF1372 Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent to 14CF1372
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Forfeit Weapon. No weapons.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  DNA, surcharge is waived.
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service within 3 years as a condition of probation. 

Expunction addressed. 
State objects to expunction. 
Court denies expunction.
Defendant's first motion and demand for discovery filed by Attorney Hawkins.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Hopper Hernandez in court with attorney Derek A Hawkins.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses Attorney Hopper's request for continuance.  The Court grants the request.  The States does not take a position on bail. The Court revokes bail and the Defendant is remanded into custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
